{"step_by_step_thinking": "Acute kidney injury (AKI) is a sudden episode of kidney failure or kidney damage that happens within a few hours or a few days. The treatment for AKI typically involves treating the underlying cause and supporting the kidneys while they heal. Currently, stem cell transplants are not a standard treatment for acute kidney injury. They are more commonly used in the treatment of certain types of cancer, such as leukemia and lymphoma, and other blood and immune system diseases.", "answer_choice": "B"}
